Package me.chloe.raiderlib.builders.drivesystems

Class SwerveDriveSystem

java.lang.Object
me.chloe.raiderlib.drive.DriveSystem
me.chloe.raiderlib.builders.drivesystems.SwerveDriveSystem
public class SwerveDriveSystem extends DriveSystem
SwerveDriveSystem class used to construct a SwerveBase in a very simplistic way. Automatically implements XboxController control on USB port 0. Rewritten from GRR 340's 2022 SwerveCode (Referencing the Google Slide made by Rob Heslin of 340 for basic functionality of Swerve Drive).
See Also:
  • 340's Swerve Programming Slide

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Method Details

    • periodic

      public void periodic()
      Description copied from class: DriveSystem
      Override for odometry. It is recommended that the super constructor be called as it enables the handling of XboxController-based driving as well as PIDExports. XboxController-based driving is disabled while in Autonomous to not screw up possible Autonomous drive handling.
      Overrides:
      periodic in class DriveSystem

    • driveRobotCentric

      public void driveRobotCentric(edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.ChassisSpeeds chassisSpeeds)

    • driveRobotCentricDutyCycle

      public void driveRobotCentricDutyCycle(edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.ChassisSpeeds chassisSpeeds)
      Drive the robot but expecting ChassisSpeeds to contain doubles that are in ControlPercent (DutyCycle) form. Aka -1.0 through 1.0 with 0.0 being at rest.
      Parameters:
      chassisSpeeds - Desired ChassisSpeeds

    • setDrivePIDF

      public void setDrivePIDF(double P, double I, double D, double F)
      Set the same PIDF (Porportional, Integral, Derivative, FeedForward)
      Parameters:
      P - - Porportional gain
      I - - Integral gain (NOT RECOMMENDED)
      D - - Derivative gain
      F - - Feedforward gain (In Rob we trust)
